data.title: Who was Cathriona White? Jim Carrey's ex-girlfriend who died after an overdose suicide
data.meta_description: Her estranged husband Mark Burton accuses Jim Carrey of illegally obtaining the prescription drugs Cathriona White used to kill herself
data.text:
JIM Carrey will face a wrongful death trial over the suicide of his late ex-girlfriend Cathriona White following a claim that he supplied the drugs that contributed to her death.

But who was Cathriona? Who is making the accusations and what happens now? Here's the latest on the case...

Who was Cathriona White?

Cathriona White was a make-up artist from County Tipperary, Ireland.

From 2012 to her death in 2015, she was on/off dating the Hollywood actor, Jim Carrey.

The talented 30-year-old worked on as a stylist on a number of high-profile over the years and working with famous celebrities such as David Hasselhoff and Lyndie Greenwood.

However, Cathriona suffered from depression, and had threatened suicide before taking her live in 2015.

She passed away on September 28 after overdosing on a variety of prescription pills at her home in Los Angeles.

Before committing suicide, she wrote on Twitter: "Signing off Twitter, I hope I have been a light to my nearest and dearest. Peace and love to you all."

Did she leave any suicide notes?

Following her death, it emerged that Cathriona threatened suicide during her relationship with Carrey, writing that she was “too messed up for anyone to love” in one message in 2012, reports TMZ.

In another, after they split in 2013, she accused Carrey, 54, of giving her STDs and wrote: “My blood is on your hands,” investigators have found.

In a suicide note, she tells Carrey "Jim You ruined my life. And even after doing so you added insult upon insult on top," she writes in one note for 2012.

Ahead of her death, she also uploaded an image to Instagram with the caption: "Faeries, come take me out of this dull world,

"For I would ride with you upon the wind,

"Run on the top of the dishevelled tide, And dance upon the mountains like a flame. W.B. Yeats."

Another not written by her two years before she took her own life has also come to light.

It alleges that the Hollywood actor introduced Cathriona to drugs, prostitutes, and STDs.

The note was written on her iPad on April 8, 2013 but it is not known if she sent it to the Canadian-born actor, reported DailyMail.com.

Cathriona White was a talented make-up artist from Ireland who dated the Hollywood actor from 2012

Who is Mark Burton?

At the time of her death, Cathriona was married to Mark Burton, a cameraman she met in Los Angeles while work on an online comedy series.

Ed Winter, the assistant chief of the Los Angeles coroner’s office, told The Times: "I understand that she and Mr Burton were going to divorce but they were still officially married at the time of her death so he is her official next-of-kin."

Mark Burton claims his lawsuit is "on the grounds of wrongful death and violation of the drug dealer liability act".

It accuses Carrey of illegally obtaining the prescription drugs which Cathriona used to kill herself.

The lawsuit also claims the actor gave her the drugs “despite the fact that he knew full well that Ms. White was ill equipped to ingest and manage highly addictive prescription drugs outside the care of a licensed physician; was prone to depression; and had previously attempted to take her own life.”

The coroner’s report stated that the bottles of likely used for Cathriona's suicide were under the name of Arthur King.

Cathriona's mother has since supported the claim.

How has Jim Carrey reacted?

Carrey has since released a statement saying the filing is a "terrible shame".

The 54-year-old added: "It would be easy for me to get in a back room with this man's lawyer and make this go away, but there are some moments in life when you have to stand up and defend your honour against the evil in this world.

"I will not tolerate this heartless attempt to exploit me or the woman I loved.

"Cat's troubles were born long before I met her and sadly her tragic end was beyond anyone's control.

"I really hope that some day soon people will stop trying to profit from this and let her rest in peace."

Did Jim Carrey stand trial?

In June 2017, a judge confirmed a trial will go ahead over claims Jim used his "wealth, influence and celebrity status" to provide the prescription drugs that contributed to the overdose of Cathriona.

The trial was expected to begin in April 2018, and Jim was expected to face a jury over claims of wrongful death and allegations under the Drug Dealer Liability Act in America.

Jim reportedly tried to seek a privacy request, but a judge denied the request and his attempts to remove allegations that he transmitted STDs to Cathriona - with the judge ruling Jim's privacy concerns are not a top priority.

Before the case even got to trial, Jim was cleared wrongful death after his lawyer proved Cathriona tried to blackmail the actor with faked STD test results.

White's family claimed Jim supplied her with drugs following her fatal overdose in 2015 and infected her with three sexually-transmitted diseases (STDs).

Jim's legal team proved that White forged medical records which showed that she had no STDs before she met Carrey.

The wrongful death lawsuits, filed by White’s estranged husband Mark Burton, and mother Brigid Sweetman, were dismissed January 25, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

The Ace Ventura star filed a countersuit last September claiming that the legal action was an attempt to exploit a famous actor.

Carrey claimed that White tried to blackmail him by threatening to feed the press with false allegations that he had infected her with STDs.

She also alleged that the actor, known for hit movies such as Dumb and Dumber and The Truman Show, introduced her "to cocaine and prostitutes".

White’s family alleged that Carrey supplied her with illegal drugs which she used to overdose.

They also claimed that the alleged STDs contributed to her mental distress.

Last year, Carrey’s attorney Raymond Boucher demanded that the court compel Burton to provide White’s STD test results.

The actor’s legal team concluded that the 2011 document, showing that White was clear of STDs before she met Carrey, had been forged.

A spokesman for Carrey told the Hollywood Reporter: “Jim is looking forward to moving on with his life now.”

A lawyer representing White’s family reportedly said: “We have no further comment at this time.”

If you are affected by any of the issues raised in this article, please call the Samaritans on (free) 116123 or 020 7734 2800.
